column4: you'd better not beryl even on your system if you are running compiz
.. it's just the version that comes with ubuntu
well there is a diff between compiz, beryl and compiz-fusion
its not in standard repos either
.. I don't see anything else there then the default compiz ..
I just said, you have to add repositories
no, compiz-fusion isnt installed by default in feisty
maybe there is an iso with compiz in it by default?
however, if you DID install gutsy, thats possible since they plan to make compiz-fusion be standard IF
but if you are truly on 7.04/Feisty, compiz-fusion isnt default, because its not even in the standard repos (you have to add the amaranth repos or trevino ones)
if you check out that page I pasted now twice to you, you'll see
hehe - no prob man.. lots of things happen..just that the standard Ubuntu/Kubuntu ISOs purposely left compiz-fusion out, cuz it wasnt near ready in July :)
Basically, beryl was a fork of compiz, and they have merged back together with a new product, compiz-fusion. Beryl will not be supported in the future.
